page.title: 16THE SUPERNATURAL IN EPSOM
page.content: {Lord Lyttleton's ghost was sighted in {Epsom on the 24th November, 1779 by {his friend Peter Andrews. Lord Lyttleton was told by a woman that he would die in 3 days. On the 3rd day he went to a party and told his friends he would "bilk the ghost". After 11PM in the process of being undressed by his servant, William Stukey, he gave a sudden gasp and fell into his arms dead. At the precise moment Lyttleton died, Peter Andrews was confronted, in his own bedroom, by a ghostly figure whom he recognized as Lord Lyttleton. The figure cried out,"It's all over with me, Andrew." Andrews suspected a practical joke but discovered the truth the following day.
